Job description

Advertisement Salary: $29.44 per hour + Super
Part Time and Casual

The position will be responsible for assisting consumers to participate in Whitehorse Active Living Programs including Social Support and Transport services based on the philosophy of wellness, reablement and restorative care.

Are you looking for a meaningful job that gives you the opportunity to make a real difference in the lives of older people and people with disabilities? Are you passionate about community care, helping others achieve their goals and increasing community participation?

We are looking for committed, caring enthusiastic, positive people with exceptional communication skills to assist and monitor the well-being of clients that participate in the Active Living Programs. You will work in a variety of centre & community based setting facilitating activities that maintain and support the independence of people who are older. You will be actively involved in planning, developing and preparing activities that are relevant for program areas.

The Successful Candidate Will Have
  • Certificate III in Home and Community Care or Aged Care and Level 2 First Aid Certificate
  • A valid Victorian Driver’s Licence to drive buses with capacity to carry up to 12 people (including the driver)
  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively with groups of older people, people with disabilities and their carers from diverse backgrounds including those experiencing dementia
  • Demonstrated understanding of safe food handling techniques.
  • Excellent Customer Service. Good verbal and written communication skills.
Qualifications in Lifestyle and Leisure and Food Safety are desirable.

Further information is available from Sussy Vasquez-Lozano or Glen New on 9877 6311. Applications must address the key selection criteria outlined in the position description. Applications close 25 October 2018.

Visit http://whitehorse.mercury.com.au to register your details to apply for the position

912858058:
[

Sales Representitive

Company Name Gameco - Gas Equipment Specialist Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

THE BUSINESS
GAMECO Pty Ltd operates gas equipment and blacksmithing material supply businesses in Brisbane, Sydney, and Melbourne in Australia, and Masterton in New Zealand. Business is transacted with a wide range of customers across all of Australasia and the Pacific.
The Victorian branch business of GAMECO is situated in Preston, Melbourne, and consists of a customer retail outlet and warehouse. The branch supplies equipment to customers in Victoria, Tasmania, South Australia, and with some sales in Western Australia.
Customers procure their equipment from GAMECO via face to face counter sales, via the use of post, satchel and road transport, or via a GAMECO sales van that travels throughout regional Victoria. The branch team consists of five staff and given the size of the team and the geographical area serviced, they have developed into a mutually supportive team who support each other and their customers in any way necessary to ensure the effective functioning of the business.
MAIN DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES:
The following are the key responsibilities of the role but there may be other responsibilities added as the business evolves and grows.
 Actively seek new sales opportunities and new business for GAMECO in the Victorian area of operation
 Assist customers to identify and procure their equipment needs from GAMECO
 Maintain and grow the business relationships between GAMECO and its customers to ensure that those relationships are fruitful, profitable and harmonious
 Resolve, agree and apply solutions to business issues and problems where and when they arise
 Assist with the procurement and stocking of warehouse retail equipment, and the smooth operation of the counter sales function
GAMECO Pty Ltd ABN 93 001 367 862. STAFF POSITION DESCRIPTION
 Assist with the development of tender submissions & harmonized pricing submissions as required.
 Travel as necessary to effectively perform the duties and responsibilities of the role.
 Support the Branch Manager and other staff where and when necessary at times of staff unavailability or where other issues arise that require the incumbent’s skills and energy.
SKILLS & EXPERIENCE
Qualifications/Documents:
 Current valid driver’s license
 Current passport with at least 6 months validity remaining at all times
 Sales Diploma or Certificates would be highly regarded
 Trade qualification in the gas industry or similar industry would be desirable
Experience:
 At least 4 years of demonstrated effective selling and customer relationship management experience
 A demonstrated willingness to be a team player and assist others where necessary
 A demonstrated willingness to seek new opportunities, apply energy to tasks and not accept the status quo where improvement is required.
Skills:
 Good interpersonal skills and the ability to effectively orally communicate with individuals or groups
 Good non-verbal writing skills
 Good planning and organizational skills
 Demonstrated effective use of Microsoft programs (e-mail, MS Word, Excel, calendar) and electronic communication devices and associated programs
 A professional personal presentation
PERFORMANCE GOALS:
Before the commencement of each financial year, the General Manager and the Major Account Manager will discuss and agree a new set of performance targets for the following year. The performance targets will be tailored to support the planned activities and aspirations of the company in regards to the major accounts segment.
The performance of the incumbent in achieving these targets in conjunction with satisfactory performance of the overall role and responsibilities will assist and guide all future remuneration discussions

912855647:
[

Seeking a professional dealmaker

Company Name Apostrophe Copywriters Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 38 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Apostrophe Copywriters is on the hunt for a dealmaker, AKA business development manager or accounts executive. You’ll bring clients to the table, sell them the Apostrophe way and wrap up the business end of things before handing the packaged project over to the rest of our team to execute.


You get a severe thrill every time you close a deal. Despite your winning ways no one would describe you as ‘salesy’. You’re a ‘people person’. You only sell what you believe in.


Landing new business isn’t a challenge. You created a stock exchange of marbles before you were ten. You understand that big goals take a thousand tiny steps. And you’ve already taken twenty of them in reading this ad.


The dream clients, the jobs that make a difference, the Feel Good Do Good clients*, that\xa0brand with the 10,000% margin and rep to follow, the accounts that flex our brains and the gigs that nourish our collective souls: this is why you get up in the morning. It’s not whether you’ll land an account, it’s whether you’ll land the account.


You also understand the importance of a diverse fleet. From small boats to sail ships – there’s no business unless the dough’s rolling in. And you close off every job personally, because you actually give a shit. If this sounds like you, keep reading.


*See apostrophe.xyz


So, who exactly are we looking for?

  • You’re the type of person who immediately understands a client’s business in all its messy glory, and you can pinpoint its strengths and weakness, see where the problems lie and clearly explain how Apostrophe can solve them.
  • You’re so cool under pressure you make a meeting without air con on a 40-degree day feel like a tropical holiday. This means you can negotiate with a clear head.
  • Speaking of heads, you’ve got one for facts and figures. You’re fluent in spreadsheet, Xero, and Salesforce (or you’re great at learning those kinds of languages) and you can translate data into insights and trends, so you know where to look next.
  • Your sense of timing is impeccable, so when you’re in focus mode, even the most well-aimed paper airplane doesn’t prove a distraction. You get the task done every time, without relying on prompts or reminders (unless they’re of your own making).
  • You’re honest, accountable and stuffed to the brim with integrity. Clients, co-workers, friends and fam trust you because you always deliver what you promise, without fuss or delay.
  • You make a killer first impression and my gosh does it last – for weeks, months and years. Clients remember you and you remember their third child’s pony’s wedding anniversary. Every year. You forge strong relationships with clients from all walks of life.
  • You’re ballsy, but always know how to handle disputes or differences of opinion without ruffling feathers – clients come away thinking that the solution was most definitely their idea.
  • You know your strengths and weaknesses, and you’re happy to hear them sung at the right time, in the right way. Especially your weaknesses. Because you know that understanding the gaps in your repertoire can only mean one thing: evolution.
  • Resistance isn’t something that bothers you in the slightest – you enjoy the challenge of coming up with a better solution.
  • You know how to pick the alpha in the room before anything’s been said. In fact, you’re likely to share a few traits.
  • You listen before you speak but once you get going you could talk your way out of a Houdini straight-jacket. This means you can juggle multiple perspectives but then effectively sell in the right idea, so that everyone walks away with ownership.
  • You’re familiar with creative industries even if you’ve never worked directly for them.


Day-to-day you will:

  • Source and secure new (strategically aligned) business with complete independence
  • Identify opportunities with existing clients, and look for new growth areas to target*
  • Work to coin-related KPIs
  • Write accurate quotes, manage and attend meetings and manage the sales pipeline
  • Work alongside/report to our founder and creative director
  • Research future trends/industries to target and share your knowledge with the team.


*We work alongside digital, design and branding agencies. When it comes to direct clients, we have an affinity for brands in the following areas: tech, sustainability (architecture, food-related products, green energy), education, and health.


You’ll need to have:

  • A proven (and demonstrable) history of success in sales – show don’t tell
  • At least four years in a sales/accounts/business development role
  • A strong understanding of business development
  • Excellent communication skills
  • Solid understanding of how to leverage a brand across multiple channels
  • A little black book full of contacts, connections, and anecdotes (including the time you shared some tequila with that ECD in Texas) within the creative industries
  • The ability to negate problems before they even exist
  • A competitive spirit, a good dose of empathy and a bloody good attitude.


So, who are we?

Apostrophe Copywriters is a 40-strong copywriting collective based in Collingwood and peppered right across the globe. Two-thirds of us have worked in the world’s top advertising agencies, and the rest have made their mark (and continue to do so) by drawing inspiration from previous chapters of their life such as environmental science, naturopathy, architecture, law, music and much more. We’ve worked with global design agencies, boutique branding teams and gung-ho start-ups that are defining their own categories. We’ve wowed clients with brand stories and taglines, and smashed world records with crowdfunding campaigns. There’s almost nothing we haven’t written for or about. And we’re only too happy to accept a new challenge.


Apostrophe is a small business with big ambitions. We’re increasingly global with September 2018 seeing a new pop-up office in Amsterdam, and that’s just the beginning of our international trajectory – every month we have more clients in the US and across Europe.


The nitty gritty:

This is a full-time role on a three-month contract to start. Show us what you’re made of to make this thing permanent. Salary will be considered alongside the prowess you bring.

\xa0

Does this sound like you?

If so, please send us some impressive stats, your CV and the top three questions you’d ask our founder to identify the juiciest areas for growth. All applications should be sent to concierge@apostrophe.xyz

Various Opportunities

Company Name Office of Australian Building and Construction Commissioner Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 24 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Do you want to enhance your career working in a dynamic and exciting area of workplace relations?

This is your opportunity to work within a high profile federal government agency responsible for ensuring cooperative, productive and harmonious workplace relations in the building industry.

We are seeking applicants to fill current and future vacancies for the following roles:

  • Investigator,\xa0
  • Lawyer,\xa0
  • Agreement Assessor,\xa0
  • Wages and Entitlements Inspector,
  • Analyst,
  • Compliance Officer, and\xa0
  • General Auditor.\xa0

For more information about the responsibilities associated with each of the roles please refer to the Candidate Information Kit available on our website.

We encourage applicants from a wide range of skills and disciplines to apply. This may include (but is not limited to) those with qualifications and/or relevant work experience in industrial relations, workplace/employee relations, criminology, criminal justice, investigations or the law.

Employment contracts may vary from temporary to ongoing, full-time or part-time depending on the business requirement of the ABCC. Often these positions are required to be filled at short notice.

The ABCC operates in a challenging and progressive environment and houses permanent offices in Canberra, Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Adelaide, Perth, Hobart and Darwin. We encourage and value a diverse workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disability are encouraged to apply.

At the ABCC, we recognise, appreciate and seek to harness our people's individual skills and talents. You will thrive in our vibrant, down to earth yet stimulating environment that empowers our people to succeed.

What you’ll need to succeed

To apply, please supply the following:
  • Tell us in a maximum two page cover letter: what areas interest you and detail the relevant skills, experience or qualifications you can bring to the ABCC in relation to the following:
  • supports strategic direction
  • achieves results
  • supports productive working relationships
  • displays personal drive and integrity
  • communicates with influence.
  • A current CV.

What you’ll get in return

We recognise the increasing importance of flexible work options and family friendly work practices in maintaining a diverse, adaptive and high performing workforce. Not only will you receive high quality training and support (both formal and on-the-job), but we also offer an attractive base salary plus 15.4% superannuation.

What you need to do now

If this sounds like the perfect opportunity for you, click Apply Now or contact recruitment@abcc.gov.au for more information.

The positions available will depend on the demands of the ABCC work program and a merit pool will be established.

It is important that applicants view the full candidate information kit, available on the jobs list portal, before applying.

To be eligible for employment all preferred candidates are required to undergo pre-employment screening. Screening checks include character, security and health clearances. Some positions may require additional checks to be performed and require a security clearance.

For more information about the position and how to apply, please visit https://www.abcc.gov.au/current-vacancies.

Applications close 11:30pm, Wednesday 7 November 2018.

912860581:
[

Country Manager

Company Name Spectrum Cannabis Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 9 hours ago Number of views 89 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Medical cannabis markets are rapidly expanding in Canada and around the world. Now is your chance to join the largest, most recognized cannabis producer in the country as we set off to build something amazing, relying on established but ever-evolving brands.

\xa0

Canopy Growth Corporation ("Canopy Growth") is a listed company on the Toronto Stock Exchange (WEED), the New York Stock Exchange (CGC) and part of the S&P Composite Index. Its wholly owned subsidiaries, including its flagship Tweed and international medical companies operating under the Spectrum Cannabis brand, are leading producers of legal, regulated cannabis. With millions of square feet of licensed cannabis production, and operations spanning five continents, Canopy is the largest legal producer of cannabis in the world.

\xa0

Headquartered in Smiths Falls Ontario, Canopy Growth recognizes that employees are at the core of our success and take pride in a corporate culture that emphasizes inclusiveness, collaboration and diversity. Our employees stem from a wide range of professional backgrounds; each bringing their own unique skills and talents to the table, working together to continue our incredible momentum of growth.

\xa0

The Opportunity

\xa0

Reporting into the Managing Director – APAC, the Country Manager is responsible for the strategic direction, leadership and overall administration of Canopy Growth’s activities within Australia. He or she will oversee the P&L, staffing, sales and market activities, while ensuring all activities continue to meet the strategic objectives of Canopy Growth. The Country Manager is responsible for building and maintaining relationships with suppliers, vendors, department managers and all local stakeholders, while also maintaining direct relationships within APAC. You will customize and adapt our overall strategy into your market and replicate our Canadian success in your jurisdiction. You will ensure your market is fully integrated into the APAC structure. \xa0

\xa0

Responsibilities

    • Establish the overall vision and direction for the successful launch and operation of cannabis sales in a coordinated and strategic manner across Australia.
    • Monitor performance against goals to ensure that progress is being made, and that corrective action is taken if necessary.
    • Lead company’s planning and execution of strategies, including the go-to market strategy, to increase sales and company growth.
    • Develop, manage, and nurture new business accounts and partnerships to accomplish profit and volume goals.
    • Execute strategic marketing plan.
    • Conduct market research and analysis.
    • Conduct regular analysis on pricing effectiveness and recurring trends; create actionable item lists based on findings.
    • Oversee the formation of business partnerships and negotiation of contracts.
    • Conduct sales forecasts and weekly and/or monthly status reports.
    • Budget preparation and monitoring of P&L.
    • Monitor financial performance to ensure the operations are meeting or exceeding budgetary commitment, with support from APAC team
    • Develop performance-based incentives for the Sales Team with support from APAC team
    • Responsible for appropriate staff levels to meet requirements of the Australia operations and other operations as necessary.
    • Responsible for recruitment, hiring, terminations and performance management, with support from the APAC team.
    • Manage the morale in the staff by setting and demonstrating a strong business ethic for dealing with employees, suppliers, customers and partners.
    • Enhance and develop policies, procedures and service systems to meet the goals of the Company.
    • Support and leverage the path for product registration in Australia and build industry presence in preparation for this milestone
    • Leverage the existing regulatory framework (SAS & AP) to develop HCP awareness enabling patient access (prescribing) and medical brand development
    • Oversee event management: selects and leads medical conference presence and other educational initiatives in the community.

\xa0

Experience & Background


    • Advanced Degree, MBA or equivalent
    • 10+ years’ experience in an executive management role; experience in a regulated industry is preferred
    • Experienced professional, with the ability to develop and maintain good working relationships at all levels within the organization as well as government and industry stakeholders
    • A proven track record of success in delivering results through effective leadership in an executive management role
    • Demonstrated success in executing go to market product plans
    • Comfortable and/or familiar with a start-up environment with a flat structure
    • Ability to work autonomously, and be accountable for decision made on a national scale
    • Superior project management skills with the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously

912814054:

Client Success Manager

Company Name VETtrak Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 11 hours ago Number of views 13 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Are you a junior technology sales representative or client success manager passionate about SaaS and VET Education looking to take your career to the next level? \xa0Look no further, VETtrak is the leading student management software platform with more than 1400 Registered Training Organisation clients in Australia.

We have big plans, and we need passionate and talented people to help us transform the VET industry and change the future of education in Australia. Our ideal candidate is passionate about solving client problems with the use of technology and building strong relationships both internally and externally. You would also have a great attitude, infectious energy, outstanding organisational skills and constant drive to grow with the company.


Key Responsibilities

  • Build long-lasting relationships with new and existing clients and constantly seek out ways to exceed their expectations
  • Your primary goal is retention, so driving product utilisation and engagement through an intimate understanding of your client’s business is key
  • Grow your client spend by identifying and managing opportunities and all the commercial aspects of the sales process for existing clients, including cross-selling, expansion, upselling and renewals
  • Identify clients’ needs and challenges and coach clients on how to best utilise VETtrak to meet their requirements
  • Handle a large amount of incoming sales and account inquiries from new and existing clients via telephone and email
  • Pro-actively manage a sizable portfolio of clients based across Australia
  • Build account strategies for your new and existing clients and establish an ongoing partnership by developing success plans for clients that outline their critical success factors, metrics for success, potential issues, and provide recommendations.
  • Partner closely with other cross-functional team members to translate client business needs and product requirements into new solutions for clients.


Skills and experience

The Ideal Candidate will:

  • Love talking to clients, naturally curious and focused on identifying their pain points and how we can solve them
  • Have an exceptional phone manner and easily build relationships with clients
  • Excited about new technology with strong technical aptitude
  • Process driven
  • Excellent time management, organisational and multi-tasking skills as well as the ability to manage large amount of client’s requests
  • Open to learn and use multiple internal systems (Zendesk, Office Suite, internal CRM, etc.) during the period of transition to a single CRM system

Requisite skills

  • Minimum 2+ years working in a phone-based sales / account management capacity, at a technology company, or RTO.

  • Track record of achieving Sales KPI's and be highly numbers focussed (# calls, # renewals, # opportunities, etc)
  • Strong ability to grasp new things quickly - industry, product, technology, etc.
  • Ability to demonstrate products with focus on solving real-life problems and highlighting key benefits
  • Superior organisational skills
  • Self-starter and willingness to work as a part of a small, dedicated and professional team
  • Negotiation and objection handling skills
  • Diplomacy, tact, and poise under pressure when working through client issues.
  • Can-do attitude
  • Prior experience in education sector is highly desirable

Benefits:

  • Fun, creative and dynamic working culture where you will have space to bring your ideas to life
  • Being part of an achievement & outcome-oriented culture
  • Working for a market leader within an industry that makes real impact on people’s lives

Franchise Owner

Company Name PACK & SEND Australia Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 12 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Parcel, Freight and eCommerce Logistics Franchise Opportunity


PACK & SEND is a 100% Australian-owned company experiencing dynamic growth.


We are Australia’s leading parcel and freight reseller, saving our customers time, trouble and money.


PACK & SEND was established in Parramatta in 1993 and has grown to over 130 locations across Australia, New Zealand and the United Kingdom.


Weare taking expressions of interest from potential franchisees who may wish to become the owner/operator of a PACK & SEND Retail Service Centre.


Locations available in the Melbourne metro area include:

  • St Kilda Road
  • Mt Waverley
  • Mackenzie Street, Melbourne City
  • St Albans
  • Laverton
  • Mildura
  • Carlton
  • Campbellfield

Why Join PACK & SEND?


Online shopping and eCommerce is driving significant parcel growth and PACK & SEND with its integrated technology and retail footprint capabilities is well positioned to exploit this demand.


In FY16 our parcel shipments increased by 25%.\xa0 We’re right in the middle of an industry exploding in growth!


The largest driving force in the global economy is internet shopping which is projected to exceed $1 trillion in sales in 2017. That’s translating into more and more goods being shipped than ever before – making the delivery of parcels and freight one of the top growth industries of the next decade.


Currently, we are looking for a number of select passionate franchisees prepared to take advantage of our proven business model and to build a business that truly has a ‘no limits’ attitude to growth.


Just a few reasons to get in touch:


  • Earn income through multiple sales channels: Retail Service Centre, Phone and Online. With our online booking system, you’ll literally earn money while you sleep.
  • Growth has ‘no limits’ in this business as you'll be equipped with systems and resources to handle the movement of goods for customers located anywhere in the world.
  • Great work-life balance. Operate a business at ‘business to business’ trading hours.
  • Market leader with over 20 years’ experience with a global footprint of more than 130 Service Centre locations in Australia, the United Kingdom and New Zealand.


Submit your application using your LinkedIn profile or online at http://franchise.packsend.com.au/

Job description

About us

AUSTRAC is Australia's financial intelligence agency with regulatory responsibility for anti-money laundering and counter-terrorism financing.

We identify threats and criminal abuse of the financial system, and act to protect Australia's economy.

We also work in partnership with industry and government agencies in Australia and overseas to -

  • help keep Australia safe from financial and other serious crime
  • build and maintain trust in Australia's financial system as part of the global community.

\xa0

About the role

This is an opportunity to work in an innovative and agency-focused environment, build and maintain strong networks and relationships across AUSTRAC and external stakeholders.

\xa0

Key functions will include:

  • providing specialist writing and editing for a range of communications materials, including media releases, talking points, speeches, marketing materials, corporate publications, website, social media content, with the ability to tailor content for various internal and external audiences and stakeholders.
  • proactively engaging with internal and external stakeholders including
    • motivating AUSTRAC business units to develop effective communication materials and implement targeted strategies
    • working with AUSTRAC’s CEO and Executive team to implement media strategies
    • engaging with AUSTRAC partners agencies, including law enforcement, intelligence, policy, regulators and the financial sector to coordinate media materials and events
    • liaising with the Minister’s Office to develop media materials and coordinate Ministerial launches
  • developing and implementing strategic communications plans for internal and external audiences, in line with whole-of-government policies and priorities on digital publication and e-government service standards and accessibility requirements
  • creating and implementing activities that support the Strategic Communications team business plan and AUSTRAC’s Strategic Direction
  • undertaking procurement activities, in line with Government procurement policies, rules and procedures.

\xa0

This role will suit someone who thrives working under limited direction, with demonstrable experience, being able to lead assigned the initiatives.

Where to next

vital role in protecting the Australian community from money laundering, financial fraud and terrorism funding. \xa0The selection process now starts with

Financial Services Accountant

Job description

From humble beginnings almost 70 years ago, John Holland has been driving positive change in Australia, and is now one of the nation’s leading infrastructure and property companies. We work in Australia, New Zealand and South East Asia offering services from infrastructure and property development, to rail and building. By finding solutions to complex challenges, we transform communities to make them easier to move around, more connected and better to live in.

\xa0

We currently have an opportunity for an experienced Environment & Sustainability Advisor/Coordinator to join our team in Abbotsford to support our projects across John Holland's Southern Region (VIC, SA, TAS and NZ). This role will work across all phases of the project life cycle including pre-contracts, project mobilisation, delivery and completions to enable the teams to meet their sustainability requirements. The role will help to develop and implement governance activities, identify and develop tools and strategies to further enhance environment and sustainability performance of projects within the region.

\xa0

Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Support a culture of contemporary thinking within and between projects and other JH regions to help achieve the environmental, social, financial and governance goals of our business, customers and communities.
  • Implement actions, procedures and tools that provides surety of successful project delivery, which are in compliance with project's environmental and sustainability management plans and contractual obligations.

911425492:
[

Cyber Defence Team Lead

Company Name nbn™ Australia Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 16 hours ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Reporting to the National Manager Cyber Defence, the Cyber Defence Team Lead is a key leadership role, responsible for a specialist Cyber Security team with oversight and delivery of operational services. Understanding Security group priorities, leading the team and proactively improving processes and tools to enhance team performance and threat management are just some of the capabilities required.




Continuing to the develop the high performing team and providing strong leadership is a key aspect of the,role, as well as innovating with the current toolset and continuing to mature the capability uplift plan. The role provides thought leadership and coaching to Cyber Analysts and Engineers while providing support and subject matter expertise to the National Manager Cyber Defence and broader company. Engagement with the wider Security Group will be required to communicate technical controls weaknesses and advise control improvements, whilst the ability to build productive relationships and converse with technical leads from other areas of nbn including, networks, infrastructure and application platforms is critical to the role.




The Cyber Defence Team Lead is a highly skilled technical subject matter expert (SME) with responsibility for using security systems and toolsets to protect nbn assets. Whilst there is an existing 24 x 7 response capacity, this role may involve being on call 24x7 on a rotational basis for escalated incidents and will require active participation responding to these as required.




A bit about your role




Outlined below are the core duties that the Cyber Defence Team Lead will be responsible for delivering:



  • Manage all aspects of threat management and work closely with the Cyber Incident Response team to identify, detect and respond to threats, including understanding and reporting their impact on nbn.
  • Technical leadership in utilising advanced technologies and techniques to analyse and detect the presence of malicious activity.
  • Work closely with the Cyber Threat Intelligence specialists to integrate processes and tools.
  • Operating the monthly governance meeting with level one triage team.
  • Development and implementation of metrics to measure the effectiveness of the Level one function and the team as an integrated function.
  • All the skills required for this role and the opportunity it affords makes it a fantastic role with ongoing career development, growth and prospects.




A bit about you




The successful candidate will possess an extensive track record in the field of operational Cyber Security and will have previously led a security operations team or similar in a high-volume environment. You will demonstrate a working knowledge of current and recent tactics, techniques and procedures for common attack types, including frameworks, e.g. Kill Chain and Mitre Attack framework.




Technical leadership in utilising advanced technologies and techniques to analyse and detect the presence of malicious activity is required, alongside a knowledge of Security Incident and Event Management (SIEM) tools. You will also have exposure working with web and email policy management platforms as well as knowledge of end point security and malware protection capabilities.




Furthermore, effective people leadership and the ability to communicate at all levels will be essential to the success of the role, with experience in managing small teams of high-performing individuals a pre-requisite.




Life at nbn




At nbn you'll be joining a team that believes there is strength in diversity and opportunity through inclusion. We're building an inclusive and diverse workplace where different perspectives, thinking and skills are valued and people are supported to achieve their potential. We're committed to our goal of increasing the presence of women and Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples in the business and have a focus on increasing diversity amongst our leadership teams.




Continue the conversation




If you think this role might be for you, we want to hear from you. Please apply by following the links and sending in your resume only. We do not require a cover letter or any selection criteria to be addressed.




nbn is a fast moving organisation with lots to deliver - so we may not always wait until the job ad expires before reviewing applications. As a result, you should submit your application as soon as possible!




At nbn our people and our planet matter. We have an unwavering commitment to the wellbeing and safety of our employees so that everyone goes home safely each day and can perform at their peak to deliver the nbn network. nbn also aims to build a network that minimises energy use and can be operated with minimal impact on the environment.

Senior Project Manager - Demolition

Company Name AECOM Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 10 hours ago Number of views 26 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Work in our Construction Services projects from concept-completion
  • Grow your career in long-term and diverse construction projects
  • Take advantage of AECOM’s flexible working arrangements


An exciting career opportunity in AECOM’s Construction Services team has become available for a client focussed Project Manager!


AECOM Construction Services is a rapidly expanding and diversified business line of the well-known global AECOM brand. We are looking to expand our Melbourne team and hire a proven Senior Project Manager, capable of managing a project from concept to completion across industry sectors such as Civil Infrastructure, Energy, Mining, Healthcare, Defence and Education.

The successful Senior Project Manager will have a proven capability and interest to deliver projects involving multi-disciplined packages of works potentially across multiple industry sectors in an autonomous Project Management role.

The Role

The role of Senior Project Manager will allow the successful applicant to be part of our project delivery team in Melbourne and benefit from our 2019 expansion plan. This opportunity will enable the Senior Project Manager to impact and advise across all project phases, including; procurement, contract management, engineering, construction, demolition and project close out.

Suitable candidates can expect to:


  • Provide day-to-day management of our internal team, consultants and contractors, ensuring they are delivering their scope of services, performing as expected by the client and meeting project deadlines;
  • Work across diverse projects types and coordinate/cooperate across multiple stakeholders to manage project timeline and cost;
  • Prepare and develop briefs, proposals, project management plans and contract documents and administer contracts in accordance with relevant policies and procedures;
  • Develop and enhance client relationships in the long-term and work closely with providing optimal project results;
  • Utilise exceptional client-facing stakeholder engagement and proactive Project Management to grow business relationships and contribute towards future pipeline of works;
  • Demand excellence throughout the project lifecycle and add value to the project through drive, enthusiasm and a passion for client-side project management in a results-driven environment;
  • Assess consultant and contractor payment claims, variations, extension of time claims and work orders and issue site instructions;
  • Oversee and coordinate design processes, managing consultants and ensuring deadlines are met and deliverables are of a high quality;
  • Adhere to AECOM’s policies and procedures including, but not limited to the Code of Business Conduct, EEO, OH&S, Business Management System; and
  • Develop and maintain project programs, change schedules, scoping documents, risk assessments, management plans, budgets and issues registers.

\xa0\xa0

About You


In order to succeed in this fast-paced project environment you will be proven in a range of industry sectors and be a capable Senior Project Manager, ideally also with exposure to demolition and remediation projects.

This is a concept-completion Project Management role, which demands responsibilities across multiple industry sectors and works with a variety of our most valued clients, therefore an ability to show evidence of the following attributes would be ideal;


  • Relevant qualifications in Project Management or Engineering, such as a Bachelor of Engineering or Construction;
  • 10+ years relevant experience in Project Management across Australian construction, decommissioning or engineering projects
  • Demonstrated commitment to collaborative, ethical behaviour;
  • Strong commitment to quality, safety and understanding of OH&S best practice and obligations;
  • Knowledge and understanding of contracts for consulting services and understanding how to use contracts to assign responsibility and risk;
  • Proven exposure to building client relationships and utilise business development skills, including confident stakeholder management;
  • Participation in in the development of qualifications and commercially viable bid proposals
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills including the ability to develop comprehensive reports and submissions;
  • Experience with administering contracts and overseeing the work of constructors, including negotiating variations and managing progress claims.

Outbound Planning Specialist

Company Name Coles Company Location Hawthorn East, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 4 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The role

At Coles, we are passionate about providing our customers with the best possible retail experience. To help us do this, we're always searching for talented people with great ideas, energy and a passion for helping others.

Reporting to the Outbound Planning and Rosters Manager, an exciting Permanent career prospect exists for a passionate individual working to support the continuous improvement of outbound planning and roster management.

To be successful, you’ll have
  • experience in Operations, with a demonstrated ability to deliver results
  • strong problem solving background and be able to create case studies to establish root cause and impact and develop solutions to address the issues
  • strong stakeholder, time management, attention to detail and excellent communication skills, along with a strong customer and team focus will also see you excel in this role
  • good working knowledge of MS Office, particularly Excel and Powerpoint will be advantageous


Your Key Responsibilities Will Be To
  • to effectively negotiate across stakeholders in managing roster and volume changes
  • provide a strategic review of rosters and volumes across the network to optimise cost and service- working across Stores, Transport, DCs communicating roster and volume changes to impacted logistics and store teams
  • to create optimal seasonal event store delivery rosters and volumes whilst managing ad-hoc store delivery roster and volume change requests, to provide accuracy and timely availability of roster and volumes data in all systems

Culture

Coles is a fast-paced, constantly changing business that focuses your talents and challenges you to perform at your best.

As a team, we’re bold with ideas and operate with pace and passion, always looking for better ways to transform retail and delight customers.

Benefits

If that isn’t exciting enough, as a team member at Coles you
  • will receive a staff discount and exclusive team member offers
  • can enjoy a convenience store located onsite
  • are able to sample new products and flavours before they hit the shelves
  • have access to a Fitness Centre and Body Therapy Clinic
  • will be part of a fun and inclusive culture where customer, community and team are at the heart of what we do


About Us

Today, Coles is one of Australia’s iconic retailers, providing a range of fresh food, groceries, general merchandise, liquor and fuel to millions of customers every week.

We have a combination of over 2,400 retail outlets across Australia covering Coles supermarkets, Coles Express fuel and convenience sites, Spirit Hotels and liquor stores under Liquorland, Vintage Cellars and First Choice Liquor branding.

While some things have changed over the years, one thing remains the same – our customer first strategy. We have over 112,000 fantastic team members across the country that are focused on making life easier for our customers and making a difference to the communities we serve every day.

Please Note

We prefer to deal with you directly and have not engaged an agency for this role, so if you’re interested, please apply.

At Coles, we aim to ensure our team represents the community we serve, embracing the richness of Australia's diverse population.

This role is eligible for the Team Member Referral Program

Job description

Synopsis

Traffic Engineer - City of Kingston

An exciting opportunity exists for an Engineer to join the Traffic and Transport Department at the City of Kingston. Kingston is undergoing unprecedented change, with the removal of nine level crossings and the construction of the Mordialloc Bypass representing well over $1 billion of transport investment over the new few years in the city.

The successful applicant will be an important member of the team and will gain skills and provide support in all aspects of local government traffic engineering. Under the guidance of experienced traffic engineers, you will perform duties such as investigating traffic engineering projects, responding to customer service requests, assessing planning applications, and assessing traffic management plans.

The successful applicant will have strong written and verbal communications skills and demonstrate excellent customer service skills. The position requires the applicant to have a sound knowledge of engineering principles and to take the initiative in problem solving to find solutions to traffic engineering problems.

The successful candidate will have tertiary qualifications in Engineering or an equivalent field.

As an employee of the City of Kingston you will have access to ongoing professional development and a range of employee benefits designed to promote a positive work/life balance, including social club events, wellbeing initiatives, discounted gym membership and health insurance. The City of Kingston offers flexible working arrangements including access to a planned day off every four weeks.

How To Apply

If you have the skills, abilities and attitude to take on this position, click on the APPLY button above to submit your application. If you required further information after reviewing the position description available to download below, please contact David Wang, Coordinator Traffic and Transport on 9581 4537.

Head of Brass

Company Name Loreto Toorak Company Location Toorak, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 14 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Loreto Mandeville Hall Toorak is a Catholic independent school that aims to be the leading girls’ school in Australia. Highly regarded for our pastoral care, academic, sporting, music and cultural programs, we educate women who will work towards positive social change.


Our vision, to offer a Catholic education that liberates, empowers and motivates students, is supported by a strategic direction that incorporates the belief that staff are the most valuable and critical asset of the School.


The position

We are seeking a dynamic brass educator with a proven record of excellence in teaching and performance to lead the Brass Department (P-12)


Responsibilities of the role will include:

  • A high level of competence as a trumpet and/or trombone teacher – beginner to advanced (VCE and Diploma) levels
  • A high level of proficiency in performance on their instrument/s
  • A high level of experience as a band conductor and director of chamber ensembles
  • Familiarity with all brass instruments offered at the school especially as used in bands and orchestras
  • The ability to work collaboratively and to lead a team of instrumental staff
  • Participate in staff collaboration to enhance teaching and learning, and performance practices
  • Actively participate and engage in the School’s pastoral care system which reflects Loreto values
  • Implement strategies and expectations which promote a positive learning environment
  • Provide students with a child-safe environment
  • Participate actively in all aspects of school life beyond the classroom including sport, positive and/or cultural activities

\xa0

About You

To be successful in this position, it is essential that you have:

  • Proven record of excellence in teaching and performance
  • Demonstrated experience as a brass teacher and leader
  • An enthusiastic and inclusive approach to teaching with the ability to motivate participation from differing levels and abilities
  • Exceptional organisational and time management skills
  • Strong communication skills; both written and verbal
  • Displays a high level of self-awareness and the ability to maintain positive relationships
  • Demonstrated conflict resolutions kills, maintaining a balanced perspective when making decisions
  • Ability to work flexibly under minimal supervision
  • Excellent IT skills and experience with Microsoft Programs
  • Current Teaching Registration (Victorian Institute of Teaching) not essential but highly desirable

\xa0

This position is a 0.8FTE permanent position commencing Term 1, 2019.

\xa0

If this sounds like the role for you then don’t hesitate, apply online now by clicking the ‘apply’ button. Applications close on Tuesday 23 October, 2018

Loreto Mandeville Hall is a child safe employer and is committed to the welfare of children and their protection. All potential employees and volunteers will be required to comply with the School's Child Safe Policy and Code of Conduct. Applicants will be required to undergo police and background checks in accordance with this policy
